edu.ucla.belief.ace

Class OnlineEngineSop

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.belief.ace.OnlineEngineSop

  • public class OnlineEngineSop
extends java.lang.Object
    An OnlineEngine capable of answering repeated sum-of-product (SOP) probabilistic queries efficiently. Supported SOP queries currently include:
    • the SOP value
    • partial derivatives
    • marginals
    • posterior marginals
    For a SOP engine compiled from a Bayesian network, the evaluation result is equivalent to probability of evidence.

    After we have evaluated, we can also compute answers to many additional queries by performing a second top-down pass, called differentiation, in time that is linear in the size of the circuit. These queries include, for each value of each network variable, and for each position of each potential, a partial derivative, a marginal, and a posterior marginal.

    The implementation for this class is trivial. Each method invokes a method in the superclass. The purpose of this class is to define which operations are available for the particular compile kind by selectively making operations in the superclass public.

    Author:
    Mark Chavira

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OnlineEngineSop(java.io.BufferedReader lmReader, java.io.BufferedReader acReader, boolean enableDifferentiation)
      Reads a literal map from the first given reader, reads an AC from the second given reader, and constructs an online engine linked to the read literal map and read AC.
      OnlineEngineSop(java.lang.String lmFilename, java.lang.String acFilename, boolean enableDifferentiation)
      Reads a literal map from the file having the first given name, reads an AC from the file having the second given name, and constructs an online engine linked to the read literal map and read AC.

      For each position p of the given network potential, returns p's marginal or Double.NaN if p is not a query position.

      For each position p of the given network potential, returns the partial derivative of the AC with respect to the p's parameter or Double.NaN if the position is not a query position.
      double[] potPosteriors(int pot)
      For each position p of the given network potential, returns p's posterior or Double.NaN if p is not a query position.

      Returns the variable having the given name.

      For each value x of the given network variable, returns x's marginal P(x,e) or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value.
      double[] varPartials(int v)
      For each value x of the given network variable, returns the partial derivative of the AC with respect to the x's indicator or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value.
      double[] varPosteriors(int v)
      For each value x of the given network variable, returns x's posterior P(x|e) or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OnlineEngineSop

        public OnlineEngineSop(java.lang.String lmFilename,
                       java.lang.String acFilename,
                       boolean enableDifferentiation)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a literal map from the file having the first given name, reads an AC from the file having the second given name, and constructs an online engine linked to the read literal map and read AC. Runs in time that is linear in the size of the circuit. However, the constant factor is large, since data is read from disk.
        Parameters:
        lmFilename - the first given name.
        acFilename - the second given name.
        enableDifferentiation - if true, then differentiation can be performed on the engine but the engine will require more memory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

      • OnlineEngineSop

        public OnlineEngineSop(java.io.BufferedReader lmReader,
                       java.io.BufferedReader acReader,
                       boolean enableDifferentiation)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a literal map from the first given reader, reads an AC from the second given reader, and constructs an online engine linked to the read literal map and read AC. Runs in time that is linear in the size of the circuit. However, the constant factor is large, since data is read from disk. Does not close the given readers.
        Parameters:
        lmReader - the first given name.
        acReader - the second given name.
        enableDifferentiation - if true, then differentiation can be performed on the engine but the engine will require more memory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

      • differentiate

        public void differentiate()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Differentiates the circuit. Evaluation must have been performed previously.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

      • differentiationResultsAvailable

        public boolean differentiationResultsAvailable()
        Returns whether differentiation results are available.
        Returns:
        whether differentiation results are available.

      • varPartials

        public double[] varPartials(int v)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        For each value x of the given network variable, returns the partial derivative of the AC with respect to the x's indicator or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value. The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to partial. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during differentiation. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.
        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the partials.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

      • varMarginals

        public double[] varMarginals(int v)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        For each value x of the given network variable, returns x's marginal P(x,e) or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value. The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to marginal. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during differentiation. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.
        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the marginals.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

        public double[] varPosteriors(int v)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        For each value x of the given network variable, returns x's posterior P(x|e) or Double.NaN if the value is not a query value. The result is in the form of a double[] that maps network variable value to posterior. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during differentiation. This method runs in time that is linear in the domain size of the given network variable.
        Parameters:
        v - the given network variable.
        Returns:
        the posteriors.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

      • potPartials

        public double[] potPartials(int pot)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        For each position p of the given network potential, returns the partial derivative of the AC with respect to the p's parameter or Double.NaN if the position is not a query position. The result is in the form of a double[] that maps each position to partial. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during differentiation. This method runs in time that is linear in the number of positions of the given network potential.
        Parameters:
        pot - the given network potential.
        Returns:
        the partials.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if fails.

The result is in the form of a double[] that maps each position to marginal. This method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during differentiation. This method runs in time that is linear in the number of positions of the given network potential.

      • varForName

        public int varForName(java.lang.String n)
        Returns the variable having the given name. This method is fairly efficient, merely performing a lookup in a HashMap using a string key. However, there is some overhead, so if at all possible, all calls to this method should be made during initialization, and the method should be called at most once per variable rather than once (or multiple times) per evidence set. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the given name.
        Parameters:
        n - the given name.
        Returns:
        the corresponding variable.

      • potForName

        public int potForName(java.lang.String n)
        Returns the potential having the given name. This method is fairly efficient, merely performing a lookup in a HashMap using a string key. However, there is some overhead, so if at all possible, all calls to this method should be made during initialization, and the method should be called at most once per potential rather than once (or multiple times) per evidence set. This method runs in time that is linear in the size of the given name.
        Parameters:
        n - the given name.
        Returns:
        the corresponding potential.

      • evaluationResults

        public double evaluationResults()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns value computed during the most recent evaluation. The method performs no inference. It merely retrieves the results of inference performed previously during evaluation. This method runs in constant time.
        Returns:
        the probability of evidence.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the evaluation fails.
